abstract.text: A mathematical shape that can be stroked or filled.

legalNotices.copyright: Copyright © 2025 Apple Inc. All rights reserved.

inlineContent.text: allows you to create onscreen graphical elements from mathematical points, lines, and curves. The advantage this has over rasterized graphics, such as those displayed by textures, is that shapes are rasterized dynamically at runtime to produce crisp detail and smoother edges.

abstract.text: Add high-performance 2D content with smooth animations to your app, or create a game with a high-level set of 2D game-based tools.
3D SceneKit content drawn as a flattened sprite.
A source of various particle effects.
A graphical element that draws text.
The base class of all SpriteKit nodes.
A mathematical shape that can be stroked or filled.
The values of each attribute associated with the node’s attached shader.
The blend mode used to blend the shape into the parent’s framebuffer.
A custom playground quick look for this instance.
The color used to fill the shape.
A custom shader used to determine the color of the filled portion of the shape node.
The texture used to fill the shape.
A glow that extends outward from the stroked line.
Creates a shape node with a circular path centered on the node’s origin.
Creates a shape node with an elliptical path that fills the specified rectangle.
Creates a shape node with an elliptical path centered on the node’s origin.
Creates a shape node from a Core Graphics path.
Creates a shape node from a Core Graphics path, centered around its position.
Creates a shape node from a series of points.
Creates a shape node with a rectangular path.
Creates a shape with a rectangular path that has rounded corners.
Creates a shape node with a rectangular path centered on the node’s origin.
Creates a shape with a rectangular path that has rounded corners centered on the node’s position.
Creates a shape node from a series of spline points.
A Boolean value that determines whether the stroked path is smoothed when drawn.
The style used to render the endpoints of the stroked portion of the shape node.
The junction type used when the stroked portion of the shape node is rendered.
The length of the line defined by the shape node.
The width used to stroke the path.
The miter limit to use when the line is stroked using a miter join style.
The path that defines the shape.
Sets an attribute value for an attached shader.
The color used to stroke the shape.
A custom shader used to determine the color of the stroked portion of the shape node.
The texture used to stroke the shape.
The value of a shader attribute.
An image or solid color.
A two-dimensional array of images.
A graphical element that plays video content.
Interpolate warping from source to destination warp geometry grids.

abstract.text: Change a shape node’s appearance by supplying custom shader code.
Create jagged or smooth shapes from the same array of points.

doc://com.apple.spritekit/documentation/.title: Creating a Shape Node from an Array of Points

abstract.text: Create a filled or stroked shape from a path object.
Structure your nodes for maximum performance.
A protocol that enables an object to be encoded and decoded for archiving and distribution.
A protocol that objects adopt to provide functional copies of themselves.
The group of methods that are fundamental to all Objective-C objects.
A protocol that enables encoding and decoding in a manner that is robust against object substitution attacks.
Methods that responder subclasses implement to support key binding commands, such as inserting tabs and newlines, or moving the insertion point.
A protocol that an object adopts to create a bar object in your app.
A protocol that marks classes to restore the state of your app to continue a user activity.
An interface that provides a source for shareable content to fulfill user requests to share current content.
A set of methods for converting between different frames of reference on a screen.
A set of methods that define the focus behavior for a branch of the view hierarchy.
An object that can become focused.
The container responsible for providing geometric context to focus items within a given focus environment.
The interface that determines whether a responder object supports paste configuration.
A set of standard methods that apps can adopt to support editing.
The protocol you adopt to restore an object’s state from a user activity.
A type that can be hashed into a `Hasher` to produce an integer hash value.
A type that can be compared for value equality.
A singleton actor whose executor is equivalent to the main dispatch queue.
A type with a customized textual representation.
A type with a customized textual representation suitable for debugging purposes.
A type whose instances can be encoded, and appropriately passed, as elements of a C `va_list`.
A type whose values can be implicitly or explicitly copied.
A thread-safe type whose values can be shared across arbitrary concurrent contexts without introducing a risk of data races.

abstract.text: Change how a shape uses its alpha value, such as additive blending, that results in the shape being brighter than it was before.
Adjust or animate a shape’s stroke.
Take per-pixel control of drawing the stroke or fill by supplying a custom code file.
